metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20326 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: A heap-based buffer overflow in _cairo_image_surface_create_from_jpeg() in extensions/cairo_io/cairo-image-surface-jpeg.c in GNOME gThumb before 3.8.3 and Linux Mint Pix before 2.4.5 allows attackers to cause a crash and potentially execute arbitrary code via a crafted JPEG file.

criterions.comment: gthumb package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3:3.8.3-0.1').
